intro: Brachysema modestum, commonly known as the small-leaved bluish-green herb, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
